instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3332: Bootups but no image, backlight, or HDMI feed.
threads.message:
Have a 820-3332 with image issue. It boots up and chimes, but no image to the display or to HDMI. 

LCD_PWR_EN: 0v
EP3V3GPU_EN: 0v
GPUVCORE_EN: 0v
PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG: 0v (resistance check is 16ohm approx on PH2 and 18ohms approx on PH1) but assuming this is due to the GPUVCORE_EN being 0v

I replaced U9100 with no change. (Does this chip have to be from a donor board or can one purchase online (like digi-key) work, as this is what i did)?

Any suggestions

threads.title: 820-3332: Bootups but no image, backlight, or HDMI feed.
820-3332: Bootups but no image, backlight, or HDMI feed.
820-3332: Bootups but no image, backlight, or HDMI feed.
threads.message:
Post volatges at pins 9 and 28-30 for J9000.
Pins 28-30 must get voltage at least few sec when hear chime.
Then LCD_HPD should go high too.
LCD supposed to be connected...

Did you try a known good panel?

threads.title: 820-3332: Bootups but no image, backlight, or HDMI feed.
threads.message:
All measurements done with know good display connected

Pin 9: 0v
28-30: 0v (u9000 pin2 5v, pin1: 0v).

Had the probe on each pins before applying power to the board for each test.

threads.title: 820-3332: Bootups but no image, backlight, or HDMI feed.
threads.message:
Any short there?

The LCD panel is not detected, so no image...

Pins 28-30 must get voltage (for short time) even without screen connected.

threads.title: 820-3332: Bootups but no image, backlight, or HDMI feed.
threads.message: There is no short on any of this pins, Without the screen connected, pins 28-30 is reading 0v. I believe the issue may be due to the enable signal thats reading 0V, but i replaced the GMUX chip already, U9100
